incidents.name: Multiple APIs Were Degraded for Super SIM Product

incident_updates.body: Multiple service API degraded with Super SIM were degraded between 02:43:40 pm to 02:47:20 pm, on July 7 2023, and 08:23:30 pm - 08:26:30 pm, on July 9 2023 Pacific Time. During this period of time customers may have seen 500 errors. The issue has now been resolved.
Our engineers are currently investigating the customer impact of a retroactive issue with Super SIM. We will follow up and provide customer impact details within 2 hours.

incidents.name: Inbound Messaging Loop Protection was Degraded

incident_updates.body: Twilio Messaging was degraded from 6th July 04:00 AM until 10th of July 04:00 AM Pacific Time. During this period of time customers may have experienced an issue with inbound messaging going unnoticed by the loop protection. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Errors with Debugger

incident_updates.body: Twilio Debugger was degraded and between 8:40 and 9:05 am UTC, 7/6/2023,  Alarms configured for 5 or 15 minute windows may not have been alerted, and a portion of debug events may have been missing from Console Debugger and the Monitor and Notifications REST APIs. We have achieved recovery all events have been restored to the Debugger and REST APIs. However, Alarms configured for 5 or 15 minutes that would have alerted during that time will have been skipped.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Twilio Debugger. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue in Increasing consumer lag on connect-devtools.debugevents-to-es-dp-elasticsearch-gateway-debugevents. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: TLS Based Connection Error in lookups.twilio.com Endpoint

incident_updates.body: Twilio [lookups.twilio.com] was degraded  between Jun-29 8:16am PT and Jul-5 9:29am PT. During this period of time customers may have experienced TLS based connection errors. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Automated Alert: Minimal Customer Impact

incident_updates.body: We have fully investigated the issue with Flex instance upgrade, and it was determined that the impact was limited to a small set of customers, who have been contacted individually to address any concerns. All systems are operational.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Flex instance upgrade issues. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Issue With Twilio's Status Page Portal where the Internet of Things Section Was Removed

incident_updates.body: We have sent notifications to impacted customers subscribed to the Internet of things components to recreate any previous subscriptions they had for IoT products.

We're still continuing to investigate with our provider if the deleted subscriptions can be restored. In case those subscriptions cannot be restored, you should recreate your subscriptions to Status Page updates for Internet of Things products. We'll give another update in the next 8 hours or so.

We're still investigating with our provider if the deleted subscriptions can be restored. In case those subscriptions cannot be restored, you should recreate your subscriptions to Status Page updates for Internet of Things products. We'll give another update in the next 4 hours or so.

We're still investigating with our provider if the deleted subscriptions can be restored. In case those subscriptions cannot be restored, you should recreate your subscriptions to Status Page updates for Internet of Things products. We'll give another update in 2 hours.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Around 21:00 UTC, the Internet of Things section was removed from the Twilio Status Page. When it was removed, if you were subscribed to Status Page updates for Super SIM & Programmable Wireless, you may have received an email saying you were automatically unsubscribed. We have added the Internet of Things section back to the Status Page; however, subscriptions to Status Page updates were not restored. We are investigating with our provider if the deleted subscriptions can be restored. In case those subscriptions cannot be restored, you should recreate your subscriptions to Status Page updates for Internet of Things products.

We will give you an update in 1 hour.

incidents.name: Auto-Recharge Triggering Incorrectly

incident_updates.body: We continue facing an issue with Auto-Recharge triggering firing incorrectly, starting June 13th and are continuing to work to deploy a fix. Taking into consideration the impact of this incident, we are closing this incident post and will reach the impacted customers individually for further follow-ups.

incidents.name: Connectivity Lost on 3.55% of Super SIM Devices

incident_updates.body: Connectivity on Super SIM Devices has been restored. We will close the post on Twilios Status Page. If you have been impacted by this incident and wish to continue to receive updates, please open a ticket with customer support.

Beginning at 20:28 UTC, we observed 3.5% of total data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. Our engineering team is actively working with the affected network provider to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or sooner once more information becomes available.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Super SIM data sessions drops. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.
